title: Equality of civil liberties across social groups score
subtitle: Data by [V-Dem](#dod:v-dem). Expert estimates of the extent to which social groups — defined by language, ethnicity, religion, race, region, and/or caste — are free from forced labor, have property rights and access to the justice system, and enjoy freedom of movement. Higher scores mean more equality. A score of 0 is approximately the average across all countries and years.

display.name: Equality of civil liberties across social groups
